overview: The Research Report involves a two-semester program of study, to be taken over two consecutive semesters of study. The Research Report is supervised and each student will be allocated an adviser. Students will be required to conduct and present the results of an independent piece of research in decision, risk and financial sciences.
ilo: Develop a research question in the area of decision-making in the face of uncertainty and complexity;
Design and implement an appropriate experimental protocol with human participants;
Analyse the experimental data with the appropriate statistical tools in view of the research question;
Effectively communicate the results both orally and in writing.
generic_skills: Synthesis of data and other information;
Evaluation of data and other information;
Accessing data and other information from a range of sources.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Submission of a written progress report
Submission of a draft of the Research Report

Submission of an electronic copy of the Research Report by 4 pm, Friday in Week 12. A copy of all data used and any relevant work files containing transformed data etc. will also be required  to be submitted in electronic format at the same time.
